meanings.definition: To write over or on top of something
meanings.sent1: She overwrote her name on the paper.
meanings.sent2: He overwrote the incorrect information with the right answer.
meanings.sent3: The cat overwrote the dog's paw print with its own.
meanings.sent4: The rain overwrote the words on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The artist overwrote the original sketch with new details.

meanings.definition: To write too much or excessively
meanings.sent1: He overwrote the essay and made it too long.
meanings.sent2: She overwrote the email with unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: The chef overwrote the recipe with extra ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The student overwrote the assignment, filling every page.
meanings.sent5: The author overwrote the novel, adding unnecessary chapters.
